headline: Marine Le Pen returns to court for appeal of graft conviction
subhead: The French far right's leader, sentenced in 2025 to four years in prison and a five-year ban on holding an elected office after being convicted of embezzlement of pubic funds, goes back to court with 11 co-defendants for a one-month trial starting Tuesday.

headline: Venezuela's Delcy Rodriguez faces an obstacle-strewn path
'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
Ex-Fed chiefs, lawmakers slam US probe into Jerome Powell
subhead: Powell said the Fed received grand jury subpoenas and threats of a criminal indictment relating to Senate testimony he gave in June. Ex-Fed chiefs Ben Bernanke, Alan Greenspan and Janet Yellen slammed the DOJ's probe, calling it 'an unprecedented attempt to use prosecutorial attacks' to undermine the Fed's independence.

headline: Paris FC's Ikoné stuns PSG, knocking out former club from French Cup
subhead: Paris FC beat their city rivals 1-0 at Parc des Princes in the French capital on Monday to reach the last 16 of the French Cup. It was Paris Saint-Germain's first loss at home in the competition since 2022 and first last-32 defeat since 2014.

headline: In Los Angeles, the specter of lingering pollution after major wildfires
subhead: The fires that occurred a year ago released toxic smoke that seeped into homes that were either untouched or only partially damaged. A French researcher based in California has demonstrated that these fumes contain extremely high levels of dangerous heavy metals.

headline: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

The British seniors trading tea dances at a daring cabaret
subhead: Once a month at London's The Posh Club, burlesque acts and striptease in a nightclub atmosphere delight Brits over 60, who let loose until late in the afternoon.

headline: 'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhead: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

headline: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhead: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

headline: 2027 French presidential election: A real campaign is needed to slow the far right
By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
